title: Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           670 Linwood Avenue Unit #10  Whitinsville, MA 01588                 Directions         The park headquarters is at the corner of Main and High Streets in downtown Woonsocket, RI   Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor The headquarters of the Heritage Corridor is located in the Woonsocket Depot, in downtown Woonsocket, RI. It is open Monday through Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM. The office is located at: One Depot Square Woonsocket, RI 02895 (401) 762-0250   Standard Hours    Sunday: Closed   Monday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Tuesday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Wednesday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Thursday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Friday: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM   Saturday: Closed             Weather           Summer temperatures range from 56-83F. Fall temperatures range from 30-70F. Winter temperatures range from 20-45F. Spring temperatures range from 30-70F.         Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Fees for Blackstone NHC - $0.00 At this time, none of the NPS programs offered at the Blackstone NHC have a fee. However, some of our partner sites, including the Slater Mill, are managed by non profits who do charge fees for the tours offered there.    Entrance Passes:   Annual Passes - $0.00 At this time, annual passes cannot be purchased from the Blackstone NHC as we do not have a store yet.         Visitor Centers                         The John H. Chafee Blackstone River Valley National Heritage Corridor is not a traditional National Park. Instead it is a living landscape, stretching across twenty four cities and towns in two states. Natural, cultural and historic sites are scattered across the landscape, but so much of the experience is just seeing the Blackstone Valley itself: the mills, the villages, and the waterways that tie it all together and powered the drive to industrializing America.   Please explore our website to find out Operating Hours Fees & Passes
